The video evidence: The expert's verdict mentions that a video recording was shared on social media platforms, including Facebook and WhatsApp. The video shows a man claiming to have witnessed the kidnapping at the Boulders Shopping Centre. This video serves as evidence to support the claim.
Eyewitness testimony: The man in the video provides a detailed account of the incident, describing how guns were pointed at everyone and how the woman was taken in a specific vehicle. This eyewitness testimony adds credibility to the claim.
Police response and statement: The South African Police Service (SAPS) issued a statement acknowledging the incident at the Boulders Shopping Centre. They confirmed that a woman was allegedly robbed at gunpoint and provided details of the investigation. The official response from the police lends credibility to the claim.
Contextual relevance: The claim is described as coming at a time when human trafficking of women and children is a widely discussed topic in South Africa. This contextual relevance suggests that the claim aligns with existing concerns and discussions surrounding human trafficking, further supporting its authenticity.
